alert.note: Alert for Chaves (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 22 at 1:12PM MDT until August 23 at 10:41AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in New Mexico... Pecos River Below Acme affecting Chaves County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Pecos River below Acme. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Inundation of low laying areas...mostly range land. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 AM MDT Monday the stage was 13.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:45 AM MDT Monday was 16.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below 12 feet this evening. - Action stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Pecos River Acme 13.0 13.8 Mon 6 am MDT 5.9 5.8 5.7 &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abq. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning around 1045 AM MDT.
